item.title: Report E-2024100025
item.description:
Report E-2024100025

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-03T09:21:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 20, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was shipped with defective packaging and released approximately three (3) cups of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged pail was containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024090589
item.description:
Report E-2024090589

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-02T09:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a release of LIMA-6, from a 275-gallon poly tote. The tote was crushed by other freight due to improper loading. A contractor was dispatched and observed a 0.5-gallon release isolated to the top of the tote. The contractor cleaned-up the release and performed a tote transfer. Four 55-gallon DFâ€™s were generated as waste for disposal containing impacted oil dry, impacted PPE, and cut-up tote pieces. XPO will manage all waste generated from the spill response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report X-2024091585
item.description:
Report X-2024091585

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-29T09:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-24
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor II Lloyd Conner contacted safety to report a Hazardous Spill. Lloyd stated that they were unloading trailer 570971 when they noticed a pallet that was damaged and leaking onto the trailer floor. Lloyd stated that the pallet contained 5-gallon pails of UN1760, Corrosive liquids, n.o.s., (Potassium hydroxide and ethanolamine solutions, 8, PG II. Lloyd stated that another pallet was loaded on top of the pallet containing the 5-gallon pails and crushed one of the pails on the bottom resulting in a spillage on the trailer floor and the dock plate. Lloyd stated that he set a pe rimeter around the spill and the back of the trailer. Lloyd stated that no waterways were impacted. Safety contacted CURA and spoke with Brandon Baumann for remediation. ~

item.title: Report E-2024090550
item.description:
Report E-2024090550

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-27T09:15:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a release of hazardous product, Setup 6SL. Four plastic jugs inside of two boxes became crushed by the weight of the freight on top of it. This caused a 10-gallon release of product onto the concrete dock floor in a 1â€™x2â€™ area. A contractor neutralized the release using sodium bicarbonate and overpacked the leaking and impacted product. Two drums of waste were generated: (1) 95-gallon DF containing overpacked product and (1) 55-gallon DF containing impacted cardboard, shrink wrap, PPE, and sodium bicarbonate. XPO will manage the waste disposal of the two drums. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.
